verses.text: 波阿斯去到城門，坐在那裡，波阿斯所說那個有買贖權的近親剛巧路過那裡。波阿斯說：「喂，老兄，過來坐一下吧。」他就過去坐下來了。

words.note: 所 (suǒ) nominalizes the verb, meaning 'that which is said by...'
Informal address for a male contemporary or slightly older.

verses.text: 波阿斯又邀請城裡的十個長老，對他們說：「請坐在這裡。」他們就坐下來了。

words.note: Specifically refers to community or church elders.

verses.text: 他對那個有買贖權的近親說：「從摩押地回來的拿俄米，現在要賣我們族兄以利米勒的那塊地。

words.note: Refers to a male relative from the same clan.

verses.text: 我想把這一件事告訴你，請你在眾民的長老，還有在座的各位面前，把它買下來吧。如果你肯贖就贖，假如不肯，就說出來，讓我知道；因為除了你當贖它以外，我是第一候補。」那人說：「我肯贖。」

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb when it is to be acted upon.
Lit. 'sitting in place'.
Here, refers to being the next person with the right of redemption.

verses.text: 波阿斯說：「你從拿俄米手中買下那塊地的時候，你也得娶（「娶」原文作「買」）已死的人的妻子摩押女子路得，使已死的人的名字留在他的產業上。」

words.definition: in one's hand, from one's hand
words.note: Often used idiomatically to mean 'from one's possession/control'.
Used with 時候 (shíhou) to form a temporal clause 'when...'
In biblical context, often refers to inherited land or possessions.

verses.text: 那有買贖權的近親說：「那我就不能贖它了，只怕損害了我的產業。你可以贖我當贖的，因為我沒有辦法贖了。」

words.note: Lit. 'buying-redeeming right'
Refers to inherited land or possessions.

verses.text: 從前在以色列，無論買贖或是交易，決定甚麼事，當事人就要脫鞋給對方。這是以色列中作證的方式。

words.note: Commonly used in legal/religious contexts.

verses.text: 那有買贖權的近親對波阿斯說：「你自己買下來吧。」就把鞋脫下來。

words.note: Indicates suggestion or mild command.
Introduces the object of a verb before the verb.

verses.text: 波阿斯對長老和眾人說：「今天你們都是見證人，所有屬於以利米勒、基連和瑪倫的，我都從拿俄米手中買下來了。

words.note: Refers to respected leaders, often in a religious or community context.
Someone who observes and provides testimony, often in legal or covenantal contexts.

verses.text: 我也娶了（「娶了」原文作「買了」）瑪倫的妻子摩押女子路得作妻子，使已死的人的名字留在他的產業上，免得他的名字在本族本鄉中除掉。今天你們都是見證人。」

words.note: Refers to one's immediate lineage or tribal group.

verses.text: 聚集在城門的眾人和長老都說：「我們都是見證人。願耶和華使進你家的這女人，像建立以色列家的拉結和利亞二人一樣。願你在以法他顯大，在伯利恆揚名。

words.note: Refers to respected community or religious leaders.
A transliteration of the Hebrew name for God (YHWH).
To achieve prominence or renown, often divinely bestowed.

verses.text: 願耶和華從這少婦賜你後裔，使你的家像他瑪從猶大所生法勒斯的家一般。」

words.note: Often used for gifts from a higher power or authority.
A common construction in classical and biblical Chinese for 'that which was born'.

verses.text: 於是波阿斯娶了路得作妻子，與她親近。耶和華使她懷孕生了一個兒子。

words.note: 專指男方娶女方 'specifically refers to the man marrying the woman'.
In biblical context, often refers to sexual intimacy within marriage.

verses.heading: A Grandson is Born to Naomi

verses.text: 婦女對拿俄米說：「耶和華是應當稱頌的，因為他今天沒有斷絕你有買贖權的近親，願他在以色列中揚名。

words.definition: did not have, there was not

words.note: Refers to the ancient legal and social custom of a kinsman-redeemer.
Specifically refers to the Go'el, the kinsman-redeemer in ancient Israelite law.

verses.text: 他必甦醒你的生命，養你的老，因為他是愛你的媳婦所生的；有她比有七個兒子更好。」

words.note: Implies a spiritual or vital restoration, not just waking from sleep.
Used here as a noun referring to the period of old age or aged parents.
A common construction in classical and biblical Chinese for 'that which was born'.
Forms a nominal phrase: 'the one who was born by...'

verses.text: 拿俄米把孩子接過來，抱在懷中，作他的保姆。
鄰近的婦女要給他起名字，說：「拿俄米生了孩子了。」就給他起名叫俄備得；這俄備得是耶西的父親，耶西是大衛的父親。

words.note: Verb-object compound: 起 (give) + 名字 (name).
Verb-object compound: 起 (give) + 名 (name) + 叫 (call).

verses.text: 以下是法勒斯的後代：法勒斯生希斯崙，

words.note: In genealogies, '生' means 'beget'.

verses.heading: Epilogue: Obed in the Genealogy of David

verses.text: 希斯崙生蘭，蘭生亞米拿達，

words.note: In genealogies, '生' means 'beget'.
In genealogies, '生' means 'beget'.

verses.text: 亞米拿達生拿順，拿順生撒門，

words.note: In genealogies, '生' means 'beget'.
In genealogies, '生' means 'beget'.

verses.text: 撒門生波阿斯，波阿斯生俄備得，

words.note: In genealogies, means 'begot' or 'fathered'.
In genealogies, means 'begot' or 'fathered'.

verses.text: 俄備得生耶西，耶西生大衛。

words.note: In genealogies, means 'begot' or 'fathered'.
In genealogies, means 'begot' or 'fathered'.
